div.l: Round was his face and camuse was his nose
As piled as an Ape was his sculle
He was a market beter atte fulle
Ther was no wight þat dorst hond on hym lege
But if he swor he shuld a noon a bege
A thef he was for soþe of corne and mele
And þat a sleigh and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten dynous symkyn
A wife he hade comen of noble kyn
The ꝑperson of þe town hir fader was
With hir he he ȝaf ful many a panne of bras
For þat symkyn shuld in his blod allye
She was I Fostred In a Nonnerie
For symkyn wold no wif as he seide
But she were wel I norsshid and a maide
To sauen his estate of ȝomanrye
And she was proud and pert as a pye
A ful faire sight was it vpon hem two
On holydayes by foren hir wold he go
With his Tipet wonden a bouten his hede
And she come aftir in a gyte of rede
And symkyn hadde hosen of þe same
Þer dorst no wight clepen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy þat went by the way
Þat dorst with hir onys rage or play
But he wold be slayn of symkyn
With panade or with knyf or with boyden
For Ialous folke ben ꝑparlous eủer mo
Algate þei wole her wyues wenden so
And eke for she was somdel somt̉erliche
She was as digne as wat̉er in A diche
As ful of hoker and of bysmare
Hir þought þat a lady hir shuld spare
What for hir kyndred ⁊and hir nortelrie
Þat she hade lerned in þe Nonnerie
A douȝter had þei by tweyne hem two
Of twenti ȝere with outen Any mo ennabling collatio
